references.reason: This book is a foundational work in causal inference, providing a comprehensive overview of the field and its applications.
This book introduced the PC algorithm, a widely used method for causal discovery.

references.paper_title: Optimal structure identification with greedy search
references.reason: This paper introduced the GES algorithm, a widely used greedy equivalence search algorithm for learning Bayesian networks.

references.paper_title: Ordering-based search: A simple and effective algorithm for learning Bayesian networks
references.reason: This paper introduced a novel permutation-based approach to causal discovery, significantly reducing search space.

references.paper_title: Learning directed acyclic graph models based on sparsest permutations
references.reason: This paper showed that causal discovery can be formulated as a search over the space of permutations, which has been influential in the development of ordering-based methods.
